result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:11 AM Defendant Sunshine Marie Kerr appeared by video.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Sunshine Marie Kerr.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: waiting on crime lab results, requesting additional status conference.  ADA responds- lab results may be back in November. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:04 PM Defendant Sunshine Marie Kerr appeared by audio zoom.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Sunshine Marie Kerr.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sunshine Marie Kerr appeared by video.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Sunshine Marie Kerr. Case set for prelim, def intends to waive.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
